required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Interaction Study of Digoxin and BI 10773
clinical_study.official_title: Relative Bioavailability of a Single Oral Dose of Digoxin (0.5 mg) When Administered Alone or in Combination With Multiple Oral Doses of BI 10773 (25 mg qd) in Healthy Male and Female Volunteers (an Open-label, Randomised, Two-way Crossover Study)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to investigate the relative bioavailability of digoxin after concomitant multiple oral administration of BI 10773 and a single dose of digoxin in comparison to digoxin given alone to healthy male and female subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Digoxin: Area Under the Curve 0 to Infinity (AUC0-âˆž)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1.5 hours (h) prior to the first dose and 20 minutes (min), 40 min, 1h, 1.5h, 2h, 2.5h, 3h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 10h, 12h, 24h, 48h, 72h, 96h after the first dose
primary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve of digoxin in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1.5 hours (h) prior to the first dose and 20 minutes (min), 40 min, 1h, 1.5h, 2h, 2.5h, 3h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 10h, 12h, 24h, 48h, 72h, 96h after the first dose
primary_outcome.description: Maximum measured concentration of digoxin, per period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Digoxin: Area Under the Curve 0 to Last Quantifiable Data Point (AUC0-tz)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1.5 hours (h) prior to the first dose and 20 minutes (min), 40 min, 1h, 1.5h, 2h, 2.5h, 3h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 10h, 12h, 24h, 48h, 72h, 96h after the first dose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve of digoxin in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to the time of the last quantifiable data point.

arm_group.description: Tablet, oral administration with 240 mL water
Tablets, oral administration with 240 mL water

intervention.description: Digoxin 0.5 mg as single dose, BI 10773 medium dose once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
-Healthy male and female subjects
Exclusion criteria:
-Any relevant deviation from healthy conditions

group.title: Study Total
group.description: This was a randomised, two-period cross-over trial, the two treatments administered were A single dose of 0.5mg digoxin on day 1 empagliflozin (Empa) 25 mg once daily on days 1 to 8 combined with a single dose of 0.5 mg digoxin on day 5 Between treatment periods there was a washout period of at least 14 days.

period.title: Washout Period of at Least 14 Days

group.title: Study Total
group.description: This was a randomised, two-period, cross-over trial, the two treatments administered were A single dose of digoxin 0.5 mg on day 1 Empagliflozin (Empa) 25 mg once daily on days 1 to 8 combined with a single dose of 0.5 mg digoxin on day 5 Between treatment periods there was a washout period of at least 14 days.

outcome.title: Digoxin: Area Under the Curve 0 to Infinity (AUC0-âˆž)
outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve of digoxin in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity.
outcome.time_frame: 1.5 hours (h) prior to the first dose and 20 minutes (min), 40 min, 1h, 1.5h, 2h, 2.5h, 3h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 10h, 12h, 24h, 48h, 72h, 96h after the first dose
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) set comprised all evaluable subjects who took at least 1 dose of study medication with at least 1 observation for at least 1 primary PK endpoint without any important protocol violations relevant to the PK evaluation. One subject was excluded from the PK set because the pre-dose plasma concentration of digoxin was >5% of Cmax.

group.description: A single dose of digoxin 0.5 mg on day 1.

group.title: Digoxin and Empa
group.description: Empagliflozin (Empa) 25 mg once daily on days 1 to 8 combined with a single dose of 0.5 mg digoxin on day 5.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
